column4: anyone in here really familiar with alsa and usb sound cards? maybe anyone with experience rebuilding alsa?
instaructiosn to build alsa from source for all supported cards  are on the alsa website
what usb sound device is it?
http://www.alsa-project.org/main/index.php/Matrix:Main <<<looks like now unless it's a rebadged job
recompiling alsa is not recommended in ubuntu ever or for the faint hearted...much easier to buy a compatible sound card
alsaconf is in one of the alsa packages....alsa-utils or alsa-tools I think. But that is still manual compiling...shoudl work though
good luck...you could always try open source sound....could be a solution
http://manuals.opensound.com/devlists/Linux.html << doesn't look good for OSS either
ahhh, makes sense. You'll be stuck compiling it from source then. Still not too bad
let the forum know how it goes - you may become a legend in the field of ubuntu usb sound
doubt it, ubuntu is usually a few revisons back
thanks for the update. Pretty much down to buying a new card then :-(
pretty dead channel....www.linuxquestions.org is a good bet though, full of happy experts
